\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\begin{DoxyVerb}Documentation for the simulate_foci.py file.
This file contains the class for simulating foci in space.

Author: Baljyot Singh Parmar
\end{DoxyVerb}
 

\doxysubsection{Function Documentation}
\Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a7e7ee98492c8246fce677650369fa58b}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!axial\_intensity\_factor@{axial\_intensity\_factor}}
\index{axial\_intensity\_factor@{axial\_intensity\_factor}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{axial\_intensity\_factor()}{axial\_intensity\_factor()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a7e7ee98492c8246fce677650369fa58b} 
 float \texorpdfstring{$\vert$}{|} np.\+ndarray SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+axial\+\_\+intensity\+\_\+factor (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{float \texorpdfstring{$\vert$}{|} np.\+ndarray}]{abs\+\_\+axial\+\_\+pos}{, }\item[{float}]{detection\+\_\+range}{, }\item[{\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}}]{kwargs}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Docstring
Calculate the factor for the axial intensity of the PSF given the absolute axial position from the 0 position of
the focal plane. This is the factor that is multiplied by the intensity of the PSF

For now this is a negative exponential decay i.e:
    I = I_0*e^(-|z-z_0|)
This function returns the factor e^(-|z-z_0|**2 / (2*2.2**2)) only.

Parameters:
-----------
abs_axial_pos : float|np.ndarray
    absolute axial position from the 0 position of the focal plane
detection_range : float
    detection range of the function. This is the standard deviation of the gaussian function describing the axial intensity decay assuming a gaussian function.
kwargs : dict

Returns:
--------
float|np.ndarray
    factor for the axial intensity of the PSF
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_aa5c4551eb4cfe1e194121b300f23f8af}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!create\_condensate\_dict@{create\_condensate\_dict}}

 dict SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+create\+\_\+condensate\+\_\+dict (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{initial\+\_\+centers}{, }\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{initial\+\_\+scale}{, }\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{diffusion\+\_\+coefficient}{, }\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{hurst\+\_\+exponent}{, }\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{cell\+\_\+space}{, }\item[{float}]{cell\+\_\+axial\+\_\+range}{, }\item[{\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}}]{kwargs}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Docstring for create_condensate_dict:

Parameters:
-----------
inital_centers: numpy array of shape (num_condensates,2) with the initial centers of the condensates
initial_scale: numpy array of shape (num_condensates,2) with the initial scales of the condensates
diffusion_coefficient: numpy array of shape (num_condensates,2) with the diffusion coefficients of the condensates
hurst_exponent: numpy array of shape (num_condensates,2) with the hurst exponents of the condensates
cell_space: numpy array of shape (2,2) with the cell space
cell_axial_range: float
**kwargs: additional arguments to be passed to the condensate_movement.Condensate class
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a3a1fcfa9a208a4b4fbe035768c159b37}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!generate\_map\_from\_points@{generate\_map\_from\_points}}
\index{generate\_map\_from\_points@{generate\_map\_from\_points}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{generate\_map\_from\_points()}{generate\_map\_from\_points()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a3a1fcfa9a208a4b4fbe035768c159b37} 
 np.\+ndarray SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+generate\+\_\+map\+\_\+from\+\_\+points (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{np.\+ndarray}]{points}{, }\item[{float \texorpdfstring{$\vert$}{|} np.\+ndarray}]{point\+\_\+intensity}{, }\item[{np.\+ndarray \texorpdfstring{$\vert$}{|} None}]{map}{, }\item[{bool}]{movie}{, }\item[{float}]{base\+\_\+noise}{, }\item[{float}]{psf\+\_\+sigma}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Docstring for generate_map_from_points:
---------------------------
Generates the space map from the points. 2D

Parameters:
-----------
points: array-like
    points numpy array of shape (total_points,2)
point_intensity: array-like
    intensity of the points, if None, then self.point_intensity is used.
map: array-like
    space map, if None, then a new space map is generated.
movie: bool
    if True, then don't add the gaussian+noise for each point. Rather add the gaussians and then to the whole add the noise.
base_noise: float
    base noise to add to the space map
psf_sigma: float
    sigma of the psf (pix units)


Returns:
--------
1. space map as a numpy array of shape (max_x,max_x)
2. points as a numpy array of shape (total_points,2)


Notes:
------
1. The space map is generated using get_gaussian function.
2. For movie: In the segmented experimental images you are adding the noise of each frame to the whole subframe,
    so for this (movie=False) add each gaussian point to the image with the noise per point.
    (movie=True) add the gaussians together and then add the noise to the final image.
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a562dcc96cc05ee1e01570cd53a2888cc}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!generate\_points@{generate\_points}}

SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+generate\+\_\+points (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pdf}{, }\item[{}]{total\+\_\+points}{, }\item[{}]{min\+\_\+x}{, }\item[{}]{max\+\_\+x}{, }\item[{}]{center}{, }\item[{}]{radius}{, }\item[{}]{bias\+\_\+subspace\+\_\+x}{, }\item[{}]{space\+\_\+prob}{, }\item[{}]{density\+\_\+dif}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}genereates random array of (x,y) points given a distribution using accept/reject method

Parameters
----------
pdf : function
    function which defines the distribution to sample from
total_points : int
    total points to sample
min_x : float
    lower bound to the support of the distribution
max_x : float
    upper bound to the support of the distribution
center : array-like of float
    coordinates of the center of the top hat
redius : float
    raidus of the top hat
bias_subspace : float
    probability at the top hat
space_prob : float
    probaility everywhere not at the top hat

Returns
-------
array-like
    [x,y] coordinates of the points sampled from the distribution defined in pdf
\end{DoxyVerb}

 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a683fe781fc2335d257afcd0d163ff789}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!get\_gaussian@{get\_gaussian}}
\index{get\_gaussian@{get\_gaussian}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{get\_gaussian()}{get\_gaussian()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a683fe781fc2335d257afcd0d163ff789} 
SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+get\+\_\+gaussian (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{mu}{, }\item[{}]{sigma}{, }\item[{}]{domain}{ = {\ttfamily \mbox{[}list(range(10)),~list(range(10))\mbox{]}}}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Parameters
----------
mu : array-like or float of floats
    center position of gaussian (x,y) or collection of (x,y)
sigma : float or array-like of floats of shape mu
    sigma of the gaussian
domain : array-like, Defaults to 0->9 for x,y
    x,y domain over which this gassuain is over


Returns
-------
array-like 2D
    values of the gaussian centered at mu with sigma across the (x,y) points defined in domain

Notes:
------
THIS IS IMPORTANT: MAKE SURE THE TYPES IN EACH PARAMETER ARE THE SAME!!!!
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_acd2c903191e8bd87e9cda47d536e552e}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!get\_lengths@{get\_lengths}}
\index{get\_lengths@{get\_lengths}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{get\_lengths()}{get\_lengths()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_acd2c903191e8bd87e9cda47d536e552e} 
SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+get\+\_\+lengths (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{str}]{track\+\_\+distribution}{, }\item[{int}]{track\+\_\+length\+\_\+mean}{, }\item[{int}]{total\+\_\+tracks}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Returns the track lengths from the distribution track_distribution. The lengths are returned as the closest integer

Parameters:
-----------
track_distribution: distribution of track lengths. Options are "exponential" and "uniform"
track_length_mean: mean track length
total_tracks: total number of tracks to be generated

Returns:
--------
track lengths as a numpy array of shape (total_tracks,1)

Notes:
------
1. If the distribution is exponential, then the track lengths are generated using exponential distribution.
2. If the distribution is uniform, then the track lengths are generated using uniform distribution between 0 and 2*track_length_mean.
3. If the distribution is constant, then all the track lengths are set to the mean track length. (track_length_mean)

Exceptions:
-----------
ValueError: if the distribution is not recognized.
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_aa2d8749cc330bb52bba086854ac8ed29}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!radius\_spherical\_cap@{radius\_spherical\_cap}}
\index{radius\_spherical\_cap@{radius\_spherical\_cap}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{radius\_spherical\_cap()}{radius\_spherical\_cap()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_aa2d8749cc330bb52bba086854ac8ed29} 
SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+radius\+\_\+spherical\+\_\+cap (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{R}{, }\item[{}]{center}{, }\item[{}]{z\+\_\+slice}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb} Find the radius of a spherical cap given the radius of the sphere and the z coordinate of the slice
Theory: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spherical_cap, https://mathworld.wolfram.com/SphericalCap.html

Parameters:
-----------
R : float,int
    radius of the sphere
center : array-like
    [x,y,z] coordinates of the center of the sphere
z_slice : float,int
    z coordinate of the slice relative to the center of the sphere, z_slice = 0 is the center of the sphere

Returns:
--------
float
    radius of the spherical cap at the z_slice

Notes:
------
1. This is a special case of the spherical cap equation where the center of the sphere is at the origin
\end{DoxyVerb}
 \Hypertarget{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a9637ad4226306c0f7103fa6c9fea2b3e}\index{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}!tophat\_function\_2d@{tophat\_function\_2d}}
\index{tophat\_function\_2d@{tophat\_function\_2d}!SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci@{SMS\_BP.simulate\_foci}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{tophat\_function\_2d()}{tophat\_function\_2d()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{namespace_s_m_s___b_p_1_1simulate__foci_a9637ad4226306c0f7103fa6c9fea2b3e} 
SMS\+\_\+\+BP.\+simulate\+\_\+foci.\+tophat\+\_\+function\+\_\+2d (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{var}{, }\item[{}]{center}{, }\item[{}]{radius}{, }\item[{}]{bias\+\_\+subspace}{, }\item[{}]{space\+\_\+prob}{, }\item[{\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}}]{kwargs}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Defines a circular top hat probability distribution with a single biased region defining the hat.
The rest of the space is uniformly distrubuted in 2D

Parameters
----------
var : array-like, float
    [x,y] defining sampling on the x,y span of this distribution
center : array-like, float
    [c1,c2] defining the center coordinates of the top hat region
radius : float
    defines the radius of the circular tophat from the center
bias_subspace : float
    probability at the top position of the top hat
space_prob : float 
    probability everywhere not in the bias_subspace

Returns
-------
float, can be array-like if var[0],var[1] is array-like
    returns the value of bias_subspace or space_prob depending on where the [x,y] data lies\end{DoxyVerb}
